author: jochembrouwer
content: I'm confused, it is deployed with a normal CREATE transaction so it is not necessary to mine a new address? Changing input data of the tx should not change the deployed address?

author: timbeiko
content:
**ACDE Recap**

- devnet-9: expected to launch tomorrow, using mainnet 4788 address + deployment scheme, but not the mainnet trusted setup. We'll also launch a short-lived devnet-10 after to test the validator churn limit, and then start moving towards testnets. 
- On the EL side, clients are mostly dealing with the last of hive tests (some of which are failing due to config issues - testing team looking into it!), blob gossip, and optimizations. 
- 4788 audit reviews: both Chainsecurity and Dedaub were on the call to present their audit findings, and ToB published their report (linked in ACDE agenda). The `0` timestamp and ring buffer size issues found in the first passes were the only two significant ones, and fixed in the updated bytecode. 
- Holesky launch: currently at 70-80% participation rate and finalizing, two biggest causes for the offline validators were an issue with prysm & vouch + some beacon nodes running too many validators on one instance. Both are being looked into!
- We had a presentation for EIP-7503. Slides here: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1omnj-y2L59wERsOBQRKjoIKHm5VQ1A6Sdmc2_Oa75IM/edit?pli=1#slide=id.p
- Clarification re: EIP-6780: the bullet point concerning the behavior in a post-verkle world will be removed (*"Note that when verkle tries are implemented on Ethereum, the cleared storage will be marked as having been written before but empty. This leads to no observable differences in EVM execution, but a contract having been created and deleted will lead to different state roots compared to the action not happening."*). This should not affect any current implementations.

author: chfast
content: To my understanding: mining is done on tx signature (not private key) and the signature is bound with the transaction hash (including initcode).
